alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 9:59PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Randall, eastern Deaf Smith and southwestern Potter Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 958 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Bushland to 8 miles northwest of Umbarger to 3 miles northwest of Hereford. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and up to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Hereford, Umbarger, Bushland and Dawn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
